criteria.name: completeness
criteria.description: The thoroughness and completeness of the vulnerability identification process.

score_anchors.3: Partially complete, some vulnerabilities are missed
score_anchors.5: Comprehensive, all relevant security vulnerabilities identified

criteria.name: remediation_quality
criteria.description: The effectiveness and feasibility of the suggested remediation measures for each identified vulnerability.

score_anchors.2: Poor, remediation suggestions are vague or unfeasible
score_anchors.4: Adequate, remediation suggestions are clear but may not be fully effective
score_anchors.6: Excellent, remediation suggestions are detailed and feasible

criteria.name: severity_assessment_accuracy
criteria.description: The accuracy and reliability of the severity assessments provided for each identified vulnerability.

score_anchors.1: Low, severity assessments are inaccurate or unreliable
score_anchors.3: Moderate, severity assessments are generally accurate but may be imprecise
score_anchors.5: High, severity assessments are precise and reliable

criteria.name: clarity_of_explanation
criteria.description: The clarity and comprehensiveness of the explanation provided for each identified vulnerability.

score_anchors.1: Poor, explanations are unclear or incomplete
score_anchors.3: Moderate, explanations are clear but may be too detailed
score_anchors.5: Excellent, explanations are comprehensive and easy to understand

rubric.calibration_notes: The completeness criteria were merged as they both focus on identifying all relevant security vulnerabilities. The remediation quality criteria were merged as they both evaluate the effectiveness of suggested remediation measures. The severity assessment accuracy criteria were merged as they both assess the reliability of provided severity assessments. The clarity of explanation criteria were merged as they both evaluate the comprehensiveness and clarity of explanations.

criteria.name: criterion_security_vulnerabilities
criteria.description: The function should identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities in the code.

criteria.name: criterion_input_validation
criteria.description: The function should validate user input to prevent injection attacks.

criteria.name: criterion_error_handling
criteria.description: The function should handle errors gracefully to prevent crashes.

criteria.name: criterion_documentation
criteria.description: The function should have clear documentation explaining its purpose, inputs, outputs, and security considerations.

criteria.name: criterion_file_access_control
criteria.description: Ensures the file being accessed is properly secured and not accessible to unauthorized users.

criteria.name: criterion_code_quality
criteria.description: The code should be clean, well-structured, and maintainable.

calibration.notes:
Proposals were merged by identifying common themes and resolving conflicts. The weights sum to approximately 1.0.
Refined based on: Add more detailed criteria for criterion_input_validation, such as checking for SQL injection attacks and cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.; Include examples of thorough input validation in criterion_input_validation to help developers understand what is expected.; Consider adding a new criterion, criterion_data_encryption, to evaluate the encryption methods used to protect sensitive data.
Refined based on: Clarify criteria; Specificity in input validation; Error handling
